Comments_List: Diverse wet lab skills and public speaking/science communication
Participating in different labs allowed me to explore fields and topics that I would not have gotten the ability to explore otherwise.
Lots of lab experience and research connections

Not really the "course" itself. but i feel that having the rotations together with "Methods and Logic" was overly taxing. The latter takes up two afternoon-evenings of a week and requires a large amount of time for out-of-class readings. From what I learned from my friends at MIT, their "Methods and Logic" course, which we adapted from, is meant to replace lab rotations in the first semester. Hence, I feel that Methods can be slimmed down to something like "Advanced Topics in Cell Biology" to allow more time for rotations.
